citation.article-title: Psychrotrophic, lactic acid-producing bacteria from anoxic waters in Ace Lake, Antarctica; Carnobacterium funditum sp. nov. and Carnobacterium alterfunditum sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Carnobacterium funditum sp. nov.
Carnobacterium funditum (fun.di'tum L.adj funditus-from the bottom)
= Phenon 1 : gram-positive, asporogenus rods, 0.8-1.3 x 1.7-0.8 μm, which occur singly, in pairs, or short chains (typically of four cells), motile by a single subpolar flagellum.
Old cells usually stain gram-negatively and are non-motile.
Oxidase and catalase negative, aerobic or anaerobic with better growth at 20°C anaerobically.
Resazurin is decolorized in media which support good growth, L(+)-lactic acid is the major end product from D(+)-glucose with traces of ethanol, acetic acid, and formic acid.
D(-)-ribose is fermented to lactic acid and moderate amounts of ethanol, acetic acid and formic acid.
Glycerol is fermented to mainly acetic acid and formic acid and traces of ethanol are produced.
Gas is not produced.
No growth in MRS, arginine-MRS or SL broths.
A component in yeast extract is required for good growth, and at least 0.1% yeast extract is required for good growth.
Pyruvate, lactate, formate, acetate, methanol, betaine⋄H2O, trimethylammonium chloride, glycine or an atmosphere of H2:CO2 (2 bar, 80:20) do not stimulate growth.
Acid is produced from glucose, ribose, maltose, mannose, fructose, salicin, sucrose, cellobiose, and trehalose.
Acid is weakly produced from galactose, mannitol and glycerol.
Acid is not produced from arabinose, raffinose, inulin, melibiose, hippurate, starch, dulcitol, esculin, xylose, rhamnose, sotbose, adonitol, melezitose, amygdalin, glycogen, erythritol or lactose.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Chopped meat medium and litmus milk remain unchanged.
Gelatinase negative.
Growth occurs at 0°C but not at 30°C.
The optimum temperature for growth is 22-23°C.
The optimum initial pH for growth is between 7.0 and 7.4.
Sodium is required for growth and optimal growth occurs at a sodium chloride concentration of 1.7%.
Cell walls contain meso-diaminopimelic acid.
C 18:1cis9 is a major component of its fatty acids.
Respiratory lipoquinones are not produced.
G+C content of the DNA ranges from 31.6±1.2 to 34±0.6.
The type strain pf3 (G+C=33.8±1.4) has been deposited in the DSM and ACAM (DSM 5970 = ACAM 312).
Isolated from the anaerobic monimolimnion of an antarctic lake of about seawater salinity.
